intro: Pinanga viridis, commonly known as the green bamboo palm, is a species of flowering plant in the family Araceae. It is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant features a slender, upright stem with large, glossy, dark green, pinnately compound leaves. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or white in color. Pinanga viridis is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and air-purifying properties.
